abstract: Brooklyn prosecutors charge eyeglass store owner Maksim Grinberg with applying for and receiving fraudulent loans for upwards of $3.4 million, much of which he spent on personal luxury purchases; charges are detailed in 148-count indictment, which also implicates Grinberg's estranged wife Diana Gets and medical-supply company employee Steven Schuster.
lead_paragraph: Maksim Grinberg submitted bogus applications to seven lenders, then spent the money on shopping sprees and trips to Atlantic City casinos, according to an indictment unsealed Wednesday.

headline.main: Brooklyn Eyeglass Merchant and 2 Others Are Charged in $3.4 Million Loan Fraud
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Eyeglass Merchant and 2 Others Are Charged in $3.4 Million Loan Fraud

snippet: Maksim Grinberg submitted bogus applications to seven lenders, then spent the money on shopping sprees and trips to Atlantic City casinos, according to an indictment unsealed Wednesday.
